qas.question: When was a new sarcophagus made for him?

context: John's illness grew worse and by the time he reached Newark Castle he was unable to travel any farther; John died on the night of <a0_0>18 October<a0_0/>. Numerous – probably fictitious – accounts circulated soon after his death that he had been killed by poisoned ale, poisoned plums or a "surfeit of peaches". His body was escorted south by a company of mercenaries and he was buried in <a2_0>Worcester Cathedral<a2_0/> in front of the altar of St Wulfstan. A new sarcophagus with an effigy was made for him in <a1_0>1232<a1_0/>, in which his remains now rest.
